interface.name: EnvironmentConstants.BatchLauncher

field.name: kMailErrorsRecipient
field.doc: The email address of the recipient of error emails from Curam. Property name : curam.batchlauncher.erroremail.recipient

field.name: kDisableStackTraceAttachment
field.doc: Default: false. Suppress the stack trace in the error emails. Property name : curam.batchlauncher.erroremail.nostacktrace

field.name: kDefaultErrorCode
field.doc: Default: 1. The default error code returned by a batch program. Property name : curam.batchlauncher.default.error.code

field.name: kDBtoJMSenabled
field.doc: Default: false. Specifies whether deferred processing and workflow functionality for batch programs should be enabled. When set to true the curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.notification.host and curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.notification.port properties must also be set. Property name : curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.enabled

field.name: kDBtoJMSnotificationHost
field.doc: Default: localhost. Specifies whether the host on which the database-to-JMS listener is available. This property must be set when the curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.enabled property is set to true. Property name : curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.notification.host

field.name: kDBtoJMScontextRoot
field.doc: The context root used by the Curam web client. Default value = 'Curam'. Property name : curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.contextroot

field.name: kDBtoJMSnotificationPort
field.doc: Default: 9044. Specifies whether the port on which the database-to-JMS notification listener is available. This property must be set when the curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.enabled property is set to true. Property name : curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.notification.port

field.name: kDBtoJMSnotificationUsesSSL
field.doc: Default: true. Specifies that the database-to-JMS notification listener on the application server is using SSL. Property name : curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.notification.ssl

field.name: kDBtoJMSnotificationEncoding
field.doc: Specifies the encoding of the database-to-JMS listener. Property name : curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.notification.encoding

field.name: kDBtoJMSnotificationMode
field.doc: Specifies the db-to-jms mode for the batch launcher. 0=none, 1=once per batch launcher session, 2=once per batch job. Property name : curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.notification.batchlaunchermode

field.name: kDBtoJMSNotifcationDisabledInStandalone
field.doc: Specifies that the batch launcher should not perform a db-to-jms notification when run in standalone mode. Property name : curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.notification.disabled.in.standalone

field.name: kDBtoJMSnotificationStubbed
field.doc: Default: false. For debugging batch jobs which use DBtoJMS: stubs out DBtoJMS.beginTransfer() to prevent it from creating deferred processes. JMSLiteEngine must be started to process the messages. Property name : curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.notification.test.stubtrigger

field.name: kDBtoJMSmessagesPerTransaction
field.doc: Default: 512. The number of messages per transaction processed by the database-to-JMS conversion. Property name : curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.messagespertransaction

interface.doc: These settings configure the behavior of Curam when problems occur invoking batch programs.

interface.name: EnvironmentConstants.Custom

field.name: kWorkflowWebServiceBPOPropertyName
field.doc: The name of the application BPO that workflow process enactment web services go through. Property name : curam.custom.workflow.webservicebpo

field.name: kCallbackClassPropertyName
field.doc: The name of the application class that implements the DPTicketCallback interface. Property name : curam.custom.deferredprocessing.dpcallback

field.name: kWorkResolverClassPropertyName
field.doc: The name of the application class that implements the WorkResolver interface. Property name : curam.custom.workflow.workresolver

field.name: kProcessDefinitionCacheSizePropertyName
field.doc: Default: 250. Specifies the maximum size of the process definition cache. Property name : curam.custom.workflow.processcachesize

field.name: kNoXmlAudit
field.doc: If set to true this property will disable the existing audit writer. Property name : curam.audit.audittrail.noxmlaudit

field.name: kNotificationDeliveryClassPropertyName
field.doc: Specifies the name of the application class that implements the NotificationDelivery interface. Property name : curam.custom.notifications.notificationdelivery

field.name: kDatabaseWriteCallback
field.doc: The name of the application class that implements the DatabaseWriteCallback interface. Property name : curam.custom.dataaccess.databasewritecallback

field.name: kTransactionCallback
field.doc: The name of the application class that implements the TransactionCallback interface. Property name : curam.custom.dataaccess.transactioncallback

field.name: kDisableDatabaseCallback
field.doc: If set to true this property will disable the database callback. Property name : curam.custom.disable.database.callback

field.name: kAuditWriter
field.doc: Default: curam.util.internal.misc.StandardDatabaseAudit. The name of the class which will handle the generated audit information. This class must extend curam.util.audit.AuditLogInterface. curam.util.audit.DisabledAudit may be used to globally disable auditing. Property name : curam.custom.audit.writer

field.name: kPreDataAccessHook
field.doc: The name of the class that implements the interface curam.util.audit.DataAccessHook. Property name : curam.custom.predataaccess.hook

field.name: kCustomExternalOperationHook
field.doc: Specifies the fully qualified class name of the customized external operation Hook which implements curam.util.audit.ExternalOperationHook. An external operation is an operation callable as a remote, batch, webservice or deferred process call. Property name : curam.custom.external.operation.hook

interface.doc: These settings allow a developer to replace elements of the Curam infrastructure with their own customized handlers.

interface.name: EnvironmentConstants.Database

field.name: kDatabaseTypeProperty
field.doc: The property which specifies the database type. Suggested: DB2/ORA/ZOS. Property name : curam.db.type

field.name: kPasswordProperty
field.doc: The encrypted password that corresponds to the user name specified above. The database password is never stored in plaintext in the various Curam property files. Property name : curam.db.password

field.name: kUsernameProperty
field.doc: A valid database username. Property name : curam.db.username

field.name: kOracleCacheSize
field.doc: The size of the prepared statement cache used by batch programs when run against Oracle (the prepared statement cache is based around implicit caching). Property name : curam.db.oracle.cachesize

field.name: kOracleConnectionCacheEnabled
field.doc: Turn on connection caching for Oracle outside of an Application Server. Property name : curam.db.oracle.connectioncache.enabled

field.name: kOracleConnectionCacheMinLimit
field.doc: Set Min Limit for the Cache. This sets the minimum number of PooledConnections that the cache maintains. This guarantees that the cache will not shrink below this minimum limit. Property name : curam.db.oracle.connectioncache.minlimit

field.name: kOracleConnectionCacheMaxLimit
field.doc: Set Max Limit for the Cache. This sets the maximum number of PooledConnections the cache can hold. There is no default MaxLimit assumed meaning connections in the cache could reach as many as the database allows. Property name : curam.db.oracle.connectioncache.maxlimit

field.name: kOracleConnectionCacheInitialLimit
field.doc: Set the Initial Limit. This sets the size of the connection cache when the cache is initially created or reinitialized. When this property is set to a value greater than 0, then that number of connections are pre-created and are ready for use. Property name : curam.db.oracle.connectioncache.initiallimit

field.name: kOracleConnectionCacheName
field.doc: The name used to identify the cache uniquely. Property name : curam.db.oracle.connectioncache.name

field.name: kTablespaceNameOnZOS
field.doc: Property which specifies the name of the table space used for 32k storage on DB2 z/OS. Property name : curam.db.zos.32ktablespace

field.name: kEnableForeignKeysOnZOS
field.doc: Controls whether foreign keys are generated for a z/OS database when running the Data Manager. Note on usage - If Foreign Keys are used against a z/OS database, the tables are put in a CHECK_PENDING state, causing failures when the tables are accessed. The state can only be changed through direct DBA intervention on the target platform (hence it cannot be scripted into the Data Manager which can run on remote clients). In normal usage the Data Manager invokes LOB Manager after applying the foreign keys. This means the LOB manager should be re-run after the this CHECK_PENDING state has been resolved. Property name : curam.db.zos.enableforeignkeys

field.name: kDisableForeignKeys
field.doc: Controls whether foreign keys are generated in SQL statements. By default this property is false, which means foreign key generation is enabled. However, for z/OS foreign keys will not be generated if curam.db.zos.enableforeignkeys is set to false. Property name : curam.db.disableforeignkeys

field.name: kDisableInvalidLobFileError
field.doc: This property controls the reporting of invalid LOB file paths in DMX files. The default value is FALSE. By default a build exception will be thrown, when set to TRUE a warning will be reported. Property name : curam.db.disableInvalidLobFileError

field.name: kDatabaseEncodingOnZOS
field.doc: Property which specifies whether the database being used on z/OS requires processing for EBCDIC, ASCII, or UNICODE encoding. This should be set to EBCDIC, ASCII, or UNICODE depending on the appropriate database encoding in use. EBCDIC is the default value. Property name : curam.db.zos.encoding

field.name: kDatabaseNameOnZOS
field.doc: The name of the database on z/OS. Property name : curam.db.zos.dbname

field.name: kDatabaseShortNamesRequired
field.doc: It is strongly recommended that this property be set to false. The functionality for this property is planned for removal in a future version of Curam. If you have utilized this property in previous versions of Curam please contact Curam Support for more information. Property name : curam.database.shortnames

field.name: kOracleDatabaseServiceName
field.doc: The Oracle database service name. Setting this will create database connection using Oracle service name. Property name : curam.db.oracle.servicename

field.name: kDatabaseName
field.doc: The database name. This setting will be overridden if property "curam.db.oracle.servicename" is set for Oracle database. Property name : curam.db.name

field.name: kServerName
field.doc: The database server name. Property name : curam.db.servername

field.name: kServerPort
field.doc: Suggested: 1521 (Oracle)/ 50000 (DB2). The database server TCP/IP port. Property name : curam.db.serverport

field.name: kOverrideDefaultBindings
field.doc: Suggested: false. Allows the default behavior of bindings file generation to be disabled to allow for bindings file customization. Property name : curam.db.disable.bindings.generation

field.name: kDmxLocale
field.doc: Default: en. Property that specifies the locale that will be used when inserting dmx data onto the database. The locale should be specified in the format: language_country, for example en_US. Property name : curam.dmx.locale

field.name: kReadMultiMaxOptionName
field.doc: Default: 100. Allows the developer to override the default maximum number of records returned by the readmulti (readmulti, nsreadmulti, nkreadmulti and nsmulti) operations in an application. This default value is only used if an explicit value is not set in the model. Property name : curam.db.readmultimax

field.name: kLockTimeOut
field.doc: Default: 30. Allows the developer to set the lock timeout in seconds on an Oracle database when performing a singleton select FOR UPDATE. The syntax here is to append a WAIT XX clause to the statement. This default value is only used if an explicit value is not set. Property name : curam.db.locktimeout

field.name: kBatchSizeLimit
field.doc: Default: 10. Globally defines the number of updates that can be grouped together as part of a batch update. Property name : curam.db.batch.limit

interface.doc: These settings configure Curam for database communication.

interface.name: EnvironmentConstants.Environment

field.name: kAppServerVendor
field.doc: Suggested: Should be set to BEA or IBM to reflect the Application Server which is being used. If running outside an application server this should be empty. Defines the Application Server in which Curam will be deployed. This is setup automatically when the EAR file is built using the build targets. Property name : curam.environment.as.vendor

field.name: kTnameservePort
field.doc: Suggested: 900. Port on which the tnameserv is running. Property name : curam.environment.tnameserv.port

field.name: kBindingsLocation
field.doc: Suggested: C:/Temp. Name of the file system location containing data sources. Property name : curam.environment.bindings.location

field.name: kDefaultDateFormat
field.doc: Default: yyyy MM dd. The date format. Can be set to one of: "d M yyyy", "M d yyyy", "yyyy M d", "dd MM yyyy", "MM dd yyyy", "yyyy MM dd", "d MMM yyyy", "MMM d yyyy", "yyyy MMM d", "d MMM yyyy", "MMMM d yyyy", "yyyy MMMM d", "dd MMM yyyy", "MMM dd yyyy", "yyyy MMM dd". Property name : curam.environment.default.dateformat

field.name: kDefaultDateSeparator
field.doc: The date separator. Can be set to one of: ".", ",", "/", "-". Property name : curam.environment.default.dateseparator

field.name: kDisableDynamicProperties
field.doc: Indicates if dynamic properties should be enabled or disabled. This is used by command line tools that require access to properties but cannot access the database. Property name : curam.disable.dynamic.properties

field.name: kDeprecationReporting
field.doc: Indicates if deprecation reporting should be enabled or disabled. This is used by all tools (both online and offline) that report deprecation warnings to the user (e.g. rules and workflow validation). Property name : curam.deprecation.reporting

field.name: kRoundingPrecision
field.doc: Indicates if when rounding money types in Curam, the HALF_UP algorithm will be used. This means that all Money will be rounded up. If set to true, the HALF_UP algorithm will be used. If not set, a default of true is used. Property name : curam.environment.roundingprecision.enable

field.name: kDefaultLocale
field.doc: Default: en. The default value of the language code for the server. Property name : curam.environment.default.locale

field.name: kRecordLockedSystemException
field.doc: Specifies whether a RecordLockedException should be set to a System exception. The default is false here, that it is a Application exception. Property name : curam.environment.recordlocked.systemexception

field.name: kReadmultiMaxSystemException
field.doc: Specifies whether a ReadmultiMaxException should be set to a System exception. The default is false here, that it is a Application exception. Property name : curam.environment.readmultimax.systemexception

field.name: kTransactionSQLQueryCacheDisabled
field.doc: Specifies whether any SQL queries that do a SELECT on a database table will have their results cached for the duration of the transaction in which the operation was invoked. Subsequent calls using the same SQL query will then retrieve the results from this thread local transaction SQL query cache and not read the results from the database. The default setting for disabling this cache is false so that the results of SQL queries will be cached. Property name : curam.transaction.sqlquerycache.disabled

field.name: kTransactionSQLQueryCacheLobMaximumSize
field.doc: Specifies the maximum size of a field of type CLOB or type BLOB in a result set that is allowed to be cached in the transaction SQL query cache. Property name : curam.sqlquerycache.lob.max.size

field.name: kEnableLoggingClientAuthCheck
field.doc: Default: false. When set to true, all client authorization checks will be logged to the AuthorisationLog database table. Property name : curam.enable.logging.client.authcheck

field.name: kSystemPropertyProjectName
field.doc: This parameter is required by the Rules and Workflow engines to dynamically invoke methods in the application. Property name : curam.project.name

field.name: kDisableTabCaching
field.doc: Default: false. Indicates if tab caching should be disabled. Note, this only applies to caching on the server side. Property name : curam.disable.tab.cache

interface.doc: These settings configure the environment for your Curam application.

interface.name: EnvironmentConstants.IEG

field.name: kIEGEditorApplicationCallbackClass
field.doc: Specifies the IEG Editor Application Callbacks class. Property name : curam.iegeditor.callback.class

field.name: kIEGSeparateQuestionsForLoopPageIndicator
field.doc: Specifies whether to use separate question pages when "for" looping. Property name : curam.iegruntime.questionpage.separatequestionsforloopstyle

interface.doc: These settings configure the properties which relate to the IEG Environment.

interface.name: EnvironmentConstants.JMX

field.name: kJmxMonitoringEnabled
field.doc: Whether JMX monitoring is enabled or not in the application. Property name : curam.jmx.monitoring_enabled

field.name: kJmxTransactionTracingEnabled
field.doc: Whether transaction tracing is enabled or not in the application. When this is enabled, in-flight data collection is enabled as well. Property name : curam.jmx.transaction_tracing_enabled

field.name: kJmxTransactionTracingURLFilter
field.doc: Regular expression to identify URLs for which transaction tracing data is collected. Property name : curam.jmx.transaction_tracing_url_filter

field.name: kJmxConfiguredMbeansEjb
field.doc: The list of MBeans configured in the EJB container. Property name : curam.jmx.configured_mbeans_ejb

field.name: kJmxConfiguredMbeansWeb
field.doc: The list of MBeans configured in the WEB container. Property name : curam.jmx.configured_mbeans_web

field.name: kJmxPerUserStatisticsFilter
field.doc: Regular expression to identify users for which individual statistics are collected. Property name : curam.jmx.per_user_statistics_filter

field.name: kJmxInFlightStatisticsEnabled
field.doc: Whether or not statistics about in-flight transactions are collected. Property name : curam.jmx.in_flight_statistics_enabled

field.name: kJmxEnableSQLStatementsStatistics
field.doc: Whether or not SQL statement statistics collection is enabled. Property name : curam.jmx.sql_statement_statistics_enabled

field.name: kJmxDownloadStatisticsAllowed
field.doc: Whether or not the download of JMX statistics is allowed. Property name : curam.jmx.download_statistics_allowed

field.name: kJmxDownloadStatisticsUsername
field.doc: The username of the user who is allowed to download the JMX statistics. Property name : curam.jmx.download_statistics_username

field.name: kJmxEndUserStatisticsEnabled
field.doc: Whether or not end user statistics collection is enabled. Property name : curam.jmx.end_user_statistics_enabled

field.name: kJmxEndUserStatisticsUserFilter
field.doc: Regular expression that selects users for which end user statistics are collected. Property name : curam.jmx.end_user_statistics_user_filter

field.name: kJmxEndUserStatisticsDisplayEnabled
field.doc: Whether or not the end user statistics are displayed in the browser. If true, the statistics for the current page are displayed in the top left corner of the page. Property name : curam.jmx.end_user_statistics_display_enabled

field.name: kJmxEndUserStatisticsUploadDelay
field.doc: The delay in seconds between the page reporting being loaded and the moment the statistics are uploaded. Property name : curam.jmx.end_user_statistics_upload_delay

interface.doc: These settings configure the JMX infrastructure for your Curam application.

interface.name: EnvironmentConstants.KeyServer

field.name: kDefaultUniqueIdSet
field.doc: The name of the default key set used by the application. Property name : curam.keyserver.default.unique.set

field.name: kKeyServerRetryCount
field.doc: Default: 5. The number of retries that will be performed if there is a problem communicating with the key server before that problem is reported to the user. Property name : curam.keyserver.retry

interface.doc: These settings allow a customer to configure the behavior of the KeyServer.

interface.name: EnvironmentConstants.Rules

field.name: kRulesFileAccessLocation
field.doc: The directory where the XML representation of rule sets will be created. Property name : curam.rules.file.access.location

field.name: kRulesFileAccessMultilocation
field.doc: Specifies that rule set files exist in multiple locations. Property name : curam.rules.file.access.multilocation

field.name: kRulesModelFileRDOAccess
field.doc: Specifies that RDOs should be retrieved from a Curam model file. Property name : curam.rules.model.file.rdo.access

field.name: kRulesDefaultLocale
field.doc: Default: en_US. Default locale used when creating the XML representation of rule sets. Property name : curam.rules.default.locale

field.name: kRulesGlobalsDescription
field.doc: The display/user friendly name associated with the pre-defined Globals Rules Data Object. The default value is the localized message text associated with the infrastructure catalog entry: RULES:ID_GROUP_DISPLAY_NAME_GLOBALS Property name : curam.rules.globals.description

field.name: kRulesOptimization
field.doc: Specifies the rules optimization. Property name : curam.rules.enable.optimization

field.name: kRulesFullText
field.doc: Specifies the rules engine construction of full result text. Property name : curam.rules.enable.fulltext

field.name: kRulesDebug
field.doc: Default: false. Specify whether the rules debugging should be enabled. Property name : curam.debug.rules

field.name: kRulesEmptyObjectiveListGroups
field.doc: Default: true. Specify whether the rules decision should include empty Objective list groups. Property name : curam.disable.empty.objectivelistgroups

field.name: kRulesObjectiveCalculationDateIncludedInDateRange
field.doc: Specifies the new objective calculation. Property name : curam.rules.date.range.includes.calculation.date

interface.doc: These settings configure the rules infrastructure of Curam.

interface.name: EnvironmentConstants.Security

field.name: kBreakinThreshold
field.doc: Default: 3. The number of consecutive break-in attempts that are allowed before an account is locked out. Property name : curam.security.breakInThreshold

field.name: kPasswordWarningPeriod
field.doc: The number of days, in advance, that a user should be warned (on login) that their password is about to expire. Property name : curam.security.passwordexpiry.warningperiod

field.name: kLoginWarningPeriod
field.doc: Default: 1. The number of logins, in advance, that a user should be warned (on login) that they have a limited number of logins in which they must change their password. Property name : curam.security.loginattempts.warningperiod

field.name: kSecurityCacheFailureCallback
field.doc: Specifies the security cache failure callback class. Property name : curam.security.cache.failure.callback

field.name: kSecurityIdentifierMinSearchStringLength
field.doc: Specifies the security Identifier Minimum Search String Length. Property name : curam.security.identifier.minsearch.stringlength

field.name: kAuthorisationStatus
field.doc: Default: false. Suppress the authorization checks normally performed by Curam. Property name : curam.security.disable.authorisation

field.name: kCaseSensitive
field.doc: Authentication and authorization of usernames is case sensitive by default. When this property is set to false the authentication and authorization mechanisms will ignore the case of the user. If duplicate case insensitive user names exist (e.g. caseworker, CaseWorker), authentication will fail due to an ambiguous user name. Such duplicate names will also cause the security cache to fail to initialize. Property name : curam.security.casesensitive

field.name: kCustomSecurity
field.doc: The fully qualified name of the class implementing the curam.util.security.ExternalAccessSecurity interface. This class implements the custom authentication mechanism for External Users. Property name : curam.custom.externalaccess.implementation

field.name: kCustomAuthentication
field.doc: The fully qualified name of the class implementing the curam.util.security.CustomAuthenticator interface. This class implements custom authentication verifications that will be invoked during the authentication process. Property name : curam.custom.authentication.implementation

field.name: kCustomUserScope
field.doc: The fully qualified name of the class implementing the curam.util.security.UserScope interface. This class determines the type of User logging into the application, i.e. INTERNAL or EXTERNAL. Property name : curam.custom.userscope.implementation

interface.doc: These settings configure the authentication behavior of Curam.

interface.name: EnvironmentConstants.SMTP

field.name: kSMTPHostServer
field.doc: The default mail server that is used by Curam. Property name : curam.mail.smtp.serverhost

field.name: kSMTPServerPort
field.doc: The port on which the default mail server is addressed. Property name : curam.mail.smtp.serverport

interface.doc: These settings configure the environment in which the SMTP client element of Curam operates.

interface.name: EnvironmentConstants.Test

field.name: kOverrideDate
field.doc: This property allows the date and time to be set to a known value for testing. In order to override the date and time the property should be in the format YYYYMMDDThhmmss. The 'T' character is the separator between the date and the time. It is valid to only specify the date. If the time portion of the property is not explicitly set the time will be automatically default to midnight (00:00:00). For example, the string value 20070101T175930 represents 17:59:30 on 1st January 2007. The string value 20070101 represents 00:00:00 on 1st January 2007. Property name : curam.test.override.date

field.name: kReadMultiMaxAsError
field.doc: Default: false. Specifies that a run time error should be thrown as well as a log message when the result size of Readmulti operation exceeds the maximum. This does not apply when the Treat readmulti-max as InformationalException option is enabled Property name : curam.test.treatreadmultimaxaserror

field.name: kStoreEntityKeys
field.doc: Default: false. Specifies that the values written to the database should be stored in memory for retrieval by tests. They can be accessed through curam.util.DataAccess.KeyRepository. Property name : curam.test.store.entitykeys

field.name: kStatisticTracing
field.doc: Default: false. Place a compact trace of BO method invocations in a buffered log. This representation is suitable for obtaining performance measurements. Property name : curam.test.trace.statistics

field.name: kStatisticLocation
field.doc: The name of the file which will have the statistics information generated into it. Property name : curam.test.trace.statistics.location

field.name: kSingleUserEnvironment
field.doc: Indicates whether only a single user will be active. This is the only mode supported if an IDE is used to execute Curam as a standalone Java program. Property name : curam.test.singleuser

field.name: kStubDeferredProcess
field.doc: Default: false. Specifies that it needs to use deferred processing without en-queuing in App Server. Property name : curam.test.stubdeferredprocessing

field.name: kStubDeferredProcessInSameTransaction
field.doc: Default: false. Specifies that stubbed deferred process calls should be run in the current transaction using the current database connection. If true, a new transaction will not be started for each stubbed deferred process call. Property name : curam.test.stubdeferredprocessinsametransaction

interface.doc: These settings configure those elements of Curam which are useful for Unit Testing. None of these settings should be used in a deployed application as they will either degrade performance or cause failures.

interface.name: EnvironmentConstants.Trace

field.name: kTraceLevel
field.doc: Default: trace_off. Tracing is off by default. Turn tracing on by setting the property to trace_on, trace_verbose or trace_ultra_verbose. The value trace_on is equivalent to setting curam.trace.servercalls to true. The value trace_verbose is equivalent to setting curam.trace.servercalls, curam.trace.methods and curam.trace.sql to true, while the highest trace level "trace_ultra_verbose" is equivalent to setting curam.trace.* to true Property name : curam.trace

field.name: kTraceServerCalls
field.doc: Default: false. Trace server method invocations by remote clients. Property name : curam.trace.servercalls

field.name: kTraceMethods
field.doc: Default: false. Trace all business object (BO) method invocations. Property name : curam.trace.methods

field.name: kTraceMethodArgs
field.doc: Default: false. Dump arguments to BO method invocations, including the argument type. This option is only valid if curam.trace.methods is set to true or curam.trace is set to at least trace_verbose. Property name : curam.trace.method_args

field.name: kTraceSql
field.doc: Default: false. Trace SQL statements executed by entity objects. Property name : curam.trace.sql

field.name: kTraceSqlArgs
field.doc: Default: false. Dump results of SQL select statements. Property name : curam.trace.sql_args

field.name: kTraceRules
field.doc: Default: false. Trace Curam rules execution. Property name : curam.trace.rules

field.name: kMailTrace
field.doc: Default: false. Trace the calls to the SMTP server. Property name : curam.trace.smtp

field.name: kLog4JFileProperty
field.doc: The location of the ".xml" configuration file which controls the output of logging within Curam. Property name : curam.trace.configfile.location

field.name: kOracleImplicitCacheHitTrace
field.doc: Default: false. An indicator as to whether the cache hits and misses of the Oracle prepared statement cache should be output. Property name : curam.trace.oracle.cachehits

field.name: kTraceEjbInvocationDifferentiators
field.doc: Comma separated list of invocation differentiator implementations. Property name : curam.trace.ejb.invocation_differentiators

field.name: kTraceMethodHandler
field.doc: Default: curam.util.resources.Trace.CuramMethodInvocationHandlerDefault. Name of a class implementing curam.util.resources.Trace.CuramMethodInvocationHandler to perform custom method tracing. Property name : curam.trace.method_handler

field.name: kTraceDataAccessMaxStringLength
field.doc: Default: 1000. Maximum length of a String or CLOB logged by the Data Access Layer when SQL tracing is enabled. Property name : curam.trace.dataaccess.maxstringlength

interface.doc: These control what diagnostic information (in addition to errors which are always logged) is written to the application server's diagnostics file. Note that you can set the "curam.trace.*" settings independently of the "curam.trace" settings, resulting in the union of these settings.

interface.name: EnvironmentConstants.Workflow

field.name: kWorkflowDisableAuditWDOValuesHistoryBeforeActivity
field.doc: When specified to true, this flag will ensure that no WDO values history audit information will be written before an activity is executed. Property name : curam.workflow.disable.audit.wdovalueshistory.before.activity

field.name: kWorkflowDisableAuditWDOValuesHistoryAfterActivity
field.doc: When specified to true, this flag will ensure that no WDO values history audit information will be written after an activity is executed. Property name : curam.workflow.disable.audit.wdovalueshistory.after.activity

field.name: kWorkflowDisableAuditWDOValuesHistoryTransitionEvaluation
field.doc: When specified to true, this flag will ensure that no WDO values history audit information will be written before the transitions from an activity are evaluated. Property name : curam.workflow.disable.audit.wdovalueshistory.transition.evaluation

interface.doc: These settings configure the properties which relate to the Workflow Environment.

interface.name: EnvironmentConstants.XMLServer

field.name: kEnvServerHost
field.doc: The host on which the XML Print Server resides. The property may also be specified as a '/' separated list of host names in order to use multiple XML Servers. For further information please refer to the Curam XML Infrastructure Guide. Property name : curam.xmlserver.host

field.name: kEnvServerPort
field.doc: The port on which the XML Print Server is listening. The property may also be specified as a '/' separated list of ports in order to use multiple XML Servers. For further information please refer to the Curam XML Infrastructure Guide. Property name : curam.xmlserver.port

field.name: kEnvServerPrinter

method.doc: This method formats file paths that are in string format to the format for the operating system. All forward and backward slashes are replaced with the operating system file separator. If the path ends in a slash (either forward or backward) then it is removed so all paths returned by this method are consistent. If null is passed to this method, then null is returned @param path The file path to be formatted @return The file path formatted with the operating system file separators.

class.name: StructCompare

constructor.name: StructCompare
constructor.doc:
Construct a Structure object.
@param compareObject An object that is to be compared.

constructor.name: StructCompare

method.name: equals
method.doc:
Compare the objects. This uses java reflection to compare the objects. First, if the object provided is an StructCompare instance, the actual object is retrieved. The public non-static fields of the structure are then compared. The structures are considered to be equal if they have the same identity, i.e. are the same object, or are both null.

The structures are considered to be different if they are of different classes, or if either, but not both, are null.

Otherwise, the structures are compared field by field and are considered to be equal if all their fields are equal. Fields are equal if they are both null, or if they are of "fundamental" types which compare equal.

Fields which are array types are compared element by element. Fields which are not fundamental types or array types are considered to be aggregates in their own right and are passed recursively to the equals() method. @param compareToObjIn The object to compare to or another StructCompare instance. @return Comparison indicator

method.doc:

@return A string representation of the compare object.

Check whether SQL commands should be traced. This cannot be set directly, only through the application properties {@link EnvironmentConstants.Trace#kTraceSql curam.trace.sql}.
@return An indicator as to whether SQL tracing is enabled.

method.doc:
Check whether arguments to SQL commands should be traced. This cannot be set directly, only through the application properties {@link EnvironmentConstants.Trace#kTraceSqlArgs curam.trace.sql_args}.
@return An indicator as to whether SQL argument tracing is enabled.

method.name: tracingServerCalls
tracingMethods
method.doc:
Check whether entry/exit from business process and entity methods should be traced. This cannot be set directly, only through the application properties {@link EnvironmentConstants.Trace#kTraceMethods curam.trace.methods}. A customer specific method handler can be provided by setting the {@link EnvironmentConstants.Trace#kTraceMethodHandler curam.trace.method_handler} application property to be the class name of the method handler. The class specified by this property must implement the {@link CuramMethodInvocationHandler CuramMethodInvocationHandler} interface. If no customer specific method handler is specified then the {@link CuramMethodInvocationHandlerDefault CuramMethodInvocationHandlerDefault} class is used.
@return Server call Tracing indicator.

method.name: tracingMethodArgs
method.doc:
Check whether the arguments on entry/exit from business process and entity methods should be traced. This cannot be set directly, only through the application properties {@link EnvironmentConstants.Trace#kTraceMethodArgs curam.trace.methods.args}. A customer specific method handler can be provided by setting the {@link EnvironmentConstants.Trace#kTraceMethodHandler curam.trace.method_handler} application property to be the class name of the method handler. The class specified by this property must implement the {@link CuramMethodInvocationHandler CuramMethodInvocationHandler} interface. If no customer specific method handler is specified then the {@link CuramMethodInvocationHandlerDefault CuramMethodInvocationHandlerDefault} class is used.
@return Server call Tracing indicator.

field.doc: Ultra verbose trace on. This indicates that arcane/area specific tracing should be performed, running at this trace level produces an extremely verbose log.

class.doc:
Manages debug tracing in the Curam server. By default tracing is off. You can set it through the environment to be on of
  • {@link #kTraceOff kTraceOff}
  • {@link #kTraceOn kTraceOn}
  • {@link #kTraceVerbose kTraceVerbose}
  • {@link #kTraceUltraVerbose kTraceUltraVerbose}
to control different levels of trace output. The verbosity of trace output relates to the ordinal position of the currently set traceLevel in this list.

If you are writing code that performs tracing, use the {link {@link #atLeast(Trace) atLeast} method to check the level of tracing that is set. Obviously don't write any output if trace is off. You almost certainly shouldn't if trace is on either. Use the {@link #kTraceVerbose kTraceVerbose} setting for most tracing, and {@link #kTraceUltraVerbose kUltraVerbose} for outrageously arcane stuff.

The dump method is a convenience routine for dumping the contents of objects in general, but it performs specific formatting of Curam structs whose members are domain types. @author PS

interface.name: Trace.CuramMethodInvocationHandler

method.name: setBizObject
method.doc:
Store a reference to the business object that is handled by this handler.
@param bizObject The business object which is handled by this handler.

interface.doc: CuramMethodInvocationHandler is an interface that must be implemented by all method trace handlers. A method trace handler is the class responsible for wrapping all method invocations with trace information. {@link Trace.CuramMethodInvocationHandlerDefault CuramMethodInvocationHandlerDefault} is the default class provided by Curam as a method trace handler.

class.name: Trace.CuramMethodInvocationHandlerDefault

method.name: setBizObject
method.doc:
Store a reference to the business object that is handled by this handler.
@param bizObject The business object which is handled by this handler.

method.name: invoke
method.doc:
Invoke the wrapped Business Object while writing the default trace information associated with the invocation. This trace information consists of:
  • Business Object Name
  • Method Name
  • Supplied Arguments
  • Result (or stack trace if an exception is thrown).
@param proxy The proxy instance that the method was invoked on. This is not used by this method. @param method The Method instance corresponding to the interface method invoked on the proxy instance @param arguments The arguments passed on the method invocation. @return The result of the method invocation on the wrapped business object. @throws Throwable An exception occurred in the method called on the wrapped business object.

class.doc: CuramMethodInvocationHandlerDefault is the default method trace handler for Curam. The default method trace handler is the class responsible for wrapping all method invocations with general trace information.

class.doc:
This class contains data items that are accessible to all the eligibility rule sets. It usually acts as a key in the loaders to load the required evidence. These data items are passed into the Rules Engine interface methods rather than loaded using loaders.

This class is also known as Globals RDO. @see curam.util.rules.Interrule @author PS

ItemListGroup is a super class of all the list RDOs. It may contain several ItemListGroupDtls. It acts as a container for data related to list group entries.

method.doc:
Get the rule execution status based on the rule ID. @param ruleId the rule ID. @return the rule execution status as one of the following strings:
  • {@link ResultTextWrapper#kSucceededStatus}
  • {@link ResultTextWrapper#kFailedStatus}
  • {@link ResultTextWrapper#kNotExecutedUnkownStatus}

method.name: getExecutionStatus
method.doc:
Get the rule execution status based on the rule ID and description item value. For example: getExecutionStatus("id1", "John Smith") @param ruleId the rule ID. @param itemIndex the description item value. @return the rule execution status as one of the following strings:
  • {@link ResultTextWrapper#kSucceededStatus}
  • {@link ResultTextWrapper#kFailedStatus}
  • {@link ResultTextWrapper#kNotExecutedUnkownStatus}

method.name: getExecutionStatus
method.doc:
Get the rule execution status based on the rule ID and description item values. @param ruleId the rule ID. @param itemIndex the description item values for all the list RDOs nesting the rule item.. @return the rule execution status as one of the following strings:
  • {@link ResultTextWrapper#kSucceededStatus}
  • {@link ResultTextWrapper#kFailedStatus}
  • {@link ResultTextWrapper#kNotExecutedUnkownStatus}

class.doc:
This class holds the result text data generated by the ResultTextDecoder class in the form of an object tree and provides methods to return result in XML and tab delimited text format.
@author SI

class.name: ResultTextWrapper

constructor.name: ResultTextWrapper
constructor.doc:
The constructor.
@param rulesEngineResultText the result text generated by the rules engine

method.name: getExecutionStatus
method.doc:
Get the rule execution status based on the rule ID. This method has to be called when identifying the status of a rule item which is outside of the rule list group or objective list group. @param ruleId the rule ID. @return the rule execution status as one of the following strings:
  • {@link #kSucceededStatus}
  • {@link #kFailedStatus}
  • {@link #kNotExecutedUnkownStatus}

method.name: getExecutionStatus
method.doc:
Get the rule execution status based on the rule ID and description item value. This method has to be called when identifying the execution status for a rule list group, an objective list group, any rule item within a rule list group or within an objective list group. For example: getExecutionStatus("id1", "John Smith") @param ruleId the rule ID. @param itemIndex the description item value. @return the rule execution status as one of the following strings:
  • {@link #kSucceededStatus}
  • {@link #kFailedStatus}
  • {@link #kNotExecutedUnkownStatus}

method.name: getExecutionStatus
method.doc:
Get the rule execution status based on the rule ID and description item values. This method has to be called when identifying the execution status for a rule item nested within multiple rule list groups or objective list groups. @param ruleId the rule ID. @param itemIndex the description item values for all the list RDOs nesting the rule item.. @return the rule execution status as one of the following strings:
  • {@link #kSucceededStatus}
  • {@link #kFailedStatus}
  • {@link #kNotExecutedUnkownStatus}

field.name: kSucceededStatus
field.doc: Represents the rules engine execution succeeded status.

field.name: kFailedStatus
field.doc: Represents the rules engine execution failed status.

field.name: kNotExecutedUnkownStatus
field.doc: Represents the rules engine execution not executed or unknown status. This means that the rule with the specified rule ID and the specified index information has not been executed. This could also happen due to the incorrect ID or index information being specified.

class.doc:
This class is a wrapper for the existing String representation of result text of the rules engine. It provides methods to get the information about the status of an individual rule execution status.

Once a developer has the decompressed result text he/she can construct an instance of this class by providing the result text to the constructor. After that the developer has to call one of the methods {@link #getExecutionStatus(String)}, {@link #getExecutionStatus(String, String)} or {@link #getExecutionStatus(String, String[])}.

These methods return one of the following constants:

  • {@link #kSucceededStatus}
  • {@link #kFailedStatus}
  • {@link #kNotExecutedUnkownStatus}

@author ZZ

method.name: getRuleSetID
method.doc:
This method takes a product, assessment or sub rule set ID and converts it into a unique numerical ID for a rule set. The numerical id is calculated using the following algorithm: 

 Non numerical part of the input ID is dropped and then one of the
 following is done - 10000 is added to the remaining numerical part of
 product ID; 20000 is added to the remaining numerical part of assessment
 ID; 30000 is added to the remaining numerical part of sub rule set ID.
 40000 is added to the remaining numerical part of generic rule set ID.
@param id full identifier of a product, assessment or sub rule set @return numerical ID for a rule set

class.doc:
This class contains information about the achieved objective. Its existence in the {@link RulesResult#getRulesObjectiveResultList()} indicates that the objective defined in a rule set has succeeded. It will contain information about the actual rate applicable to specific conditions if the objective defined using the Rules Editor contains Objective Tags of financial or numerical {@link curam.util.rules.TagResult#getType() type}.

Other related financial and non-financial information is contained in one or more {@link TagResult}objects.

Objectives are defined at design time using the Rules Editor. @author LJ

interface.name: UserScope

method.name: isUserExternal

interface.doc:
UserScope interface. Currently the user type (internal/external) is determined based on whether the user exists in the security cache or not. If the user exists in the Curam security cache, they are considered an internal user. If they do not exist in the cache, they are considered an external user and as such the implementation of curam.util.security.ExternalAccessSecurity will be used. As a result of this behavior all users, internal and external, must always be unique. This class provides a hook point allowing you to implement your own logic for determining if a user is internal or external, thus providing the possibility of having an internal and external user with the same username. To use your custom implementation, you should set the 'curam.custom.userscope.implementation' application property to be the fully qualified classname of the custom implementation.
@author SR

field.name: methodName
field.doc: Mandatory: the name of the method to invoke.

field.name: argument
field.doc: Optional: a struct parameter for the method being invoked.

field.name: timerName
field.doc: Optional: a name for this timer. This can be used as an identifier to query or cancel a timer.

field.name: errorHandlerName
field.doc: Optional: the name of a class, which implements interface {@link TimerCallback} which will get called if the timed method fails.

field.name: userID
field.doc: Read-only: the ID of the user who started off the task. This gets automatically populated when the timer is started.

field.name: taskID
field.doc: Read-only: a unique identifier for each task. This is automatically populated when the timer is requested.

field.name: creationTime
field.doc: Read-only: the time at which this timer was requested. This is automatically populated when the timer is requested.

field.name: initialDelay
field.doc: Read-only: the initial delay time in milliseconds which was specified when this timer was created.

field.name: initialEventTime
field.doc: Read-only: the absolute time of the first event for this timer, or null if none was specified when this timer was created.

field.name: interval
field.doc: Read-only: the repeat interval which was specified when this timer was created, or zero if it is a one event timer.

class.doc:
This class represents a public interface for the transaction SQL query cache to allow developers some control over it's behavior. The transaction SQL query cache stores the results of an SQL query in memory for the lifetime of the transaction in which the specified SQL query was invoked.

Methods are provided to enable and disable the cache at runtime for a particular transaction and to flush all of the entries from the cache for a specified table. @author FG

class.doc:
Contains context information about the currently executing business function and its transaction context. This class uses ThreadLocal variables to ensure that each concurrently executing business function in an application server has its own copy of TransactionInfo, returned by the static {@link #getInfo() getInfo} method. None of the return values from methods in this class should be stored locally. The method must be invoked each time a value is required.
@author PS

field.doc: Convenience variable holding empty Blob values which can be shared between referents.

class.doc:
Blob represents a chunk of binary data. Blobs are fundamentally immutable, which means that their values can be shared safely among multiple referents. There is one caveat. In order to minimize copying of large blocks of data, it is possible to construct a Blob with a byte array ( {@link #Blob(byte[]) Constructor}) which becomes the Blob's internal storage. It is up to the developer to ensure that a reference to the byte array is not used to modify the contents of the Blob after it has been constructed.
@author Peter Swords

class.doc:
Retrieve code table translations. Most applications make heavy use of "codes" -- compact representations of more verbose descriptions. A Curam code is a string of maximum length 10 characters, which is associated with a description which is also represented as a string. Related codes are grouped into "code tables". A code table is identified by a code table name, which is a string. Applications sometimes need to provide default values for fields which are stored as code representations. Each Curam code table can have a "default code", which is the default item from that table.
@author Peter Swords

class.doc:
Represents a Curam DateTime as a Java millisecond value. The value is truncated to the nearest second.

DateTime instances are immutable so their values can be safely shared among multiple referents.

DateTime provides convenience methods to compare DateTimes, to get the current system date/time. For other computation involving dates use the java.util.Calendar class. DateTime can be converted to an instance of this class using its {@link #getCalendar() getCalendar} method. @see Date @author Peter Swords

class.name: FrequencyPattern

constructor.name: FrequencyPattern
constructor.doc: Default Constructor.

constructor.name: FrequencyPattern
constructor.doc:
Construct a Frequency Pattern from a string. @param pattern The String representing the FrequencyPattern should be in the following format:
  • Character 1: patternType as a single digit
    • 0 : Daily
    • 1 : Weekly
    • 2 : Monthly
    • 3 : Yearly
    • 4 : Bi-monthly
  • Characters 2-4: interval as a three-digit number or, for bi-monthly patterns, the second dayOfMonth as a two-digit number followed by zero.
  • Characters 5-7: dayOfWeekMask as a three-digit number
    • 1 : Monday
    • 2 : Tuesday
    • 4 : Wednesday
    • 8 : Thursday
    • 16 : Friday
    • 32 : Saturday
    • 64 : Sunday
    • 201: `Eachday`
    • 202: Weekday
    • 203: `Weekendday`
  • Characters 8-9: dayOfMonth as a two-digit number
    • 32 : first
    • 33 : second
    • 34 : third
    • 35 : fourth
    • 36 : last
All fields are zero-padded on the left. @throws AppRuntimeException {@link INFRASTRUCTURE#RUN_ID_FREQUENCY_CONVERSION RUN_ID_FREQUENCY_CONVERSION} - if FrequencyPattern cannot be converted from String

field.name: kZeroFrequencyPattern

field.name: kEachWeekdayPattern
field.doc: A daily pattern for each week day.

field.name: kDailyPattern
field.doc: A daily pattern for each day.

field.name: kStartDayEachWeekPattern
field.doc: A weekly pattern recurring on a specified day in each week. The day used with this pattern is the day of the week corresponding to the date on which the pattern is applied. For example this pattern applied to Wednesday 14th January will result in Wednesday the 21st January.

field.name: kFirstDayOfMonthPattern
field.doc: A monthly pattern for the first day in each month.

class.doc:
A frequency pattern is a flexible way of defining the frequency with which an event recurs. Once the pattern is defined, you can use it to determine dates on which an event occurs before or after a specified date, or between a range of dates.

A frequency pattern consists of four fields. The pattern type field is one of daily, weekly, monthly, or yearly. The remaining fields -- interval, day of week, and day of month-- are interpreted differently depending on the pattern type. Below, we describe the allowable values for the day of week and day of month fields, and then explain how they work with each of the pattern types.

The day of week field is a set, which may contain any combination of days of the week from Monday to Sunday. Special values for the day of week field indicate each day (Monday to Sunday), weekend days (Saturday, Sunday), or week days (Monday to Friday).

The day of month field is a day number from 1 to 31. Special values for the day of month field are first, second, third, fourth and last. These special values in combination with a day of week indicate a particular occurrence of a week day within a month, for instance "the first Friday".

For daily patterns the interval field indicates how often the pattern recurs. The day of month field is ignored. The day of week field can be set to any of its allowable values. The simplest daily patterns have a day of week value of each day. The interval then simply defines the number of days between recurrences. If the day of week field contains any other set of days, then the interval is used to count days that are contained in the set. For example, if the set contains Monday+Wednesday+Friday, and the interval is 4, then the first occurrence after Sunday 16-Jun-2002 is Monday 24-Jun-2002 -- the fourth day in the set after the start date.

For weekly patterns the interval field indicates how often (in weeks) the pattern recurs. If the day of week field is not set, then the pattern simply recurs every nth week, where n is the interval. If the day of week field is set, then the result is computed as if no day of week was set, and then rolled forward to the next matching day of week.

For monthly patterns the interval field indicates how often (in months) the pattern recurs. If the day of month field is set to a value between 1 and 31, then the pattern recurs on the specified day of each nth month, where n is the interval. If, for any given month in which the pattern recurs, the day of month value is greater than the number of days in the month, then the pattern recurs on the last day of the month. If no day of month is specified, then the day of month is taken to be the same day as the start date (you always specify a start date when requesting a next occurrence). If the day of month is set to one of the special values -- first, second, third, fourth and last-- then the day of week field is used to determine the result. For instance, a day of month value of third in combination with a day of week of "Friday" and an interval of 2 would indicate the "third Friday" of every second month.

For bi-monthly patterns the pattern specifies two events which occur every month. Two day of month fields are required so the first two characters of the interval field are used to store the second day of month value. (The interval field is redundant since by definition the pattern occurs twice per month.) The day of month fields must both be either a numeric value between 1 and 31 or one of the the special values -- first, second, third, fourth and last. For example it is possible to specify bi-monthly patterns of the form "Day 14 and 30 of every month." and "The first and last Saturday of every month.". However it is not possible to specify a bi-monthly pattern of "Day 14 and the last Saturday of every month" because this is actually two distinct patterns and this information cannot be stored within a single frequency pattern. For bi-monthly patterns where the two components overlap, only one occurrence is returned. For example in some months the bi-monthly pattern "The fourth and last Friday of every month" will correspond to one day, in other months it will correspond to two different days. In the case where it corresponds to a single day, only one occurrence is returned. Similarly it is possible - although misleading - to specify a bi-monthly pattern where each of the two components are identical. In this case the result is the same as a one-monthly pattern. For example the bi-monthly pattern "The first and first day of every month" will behave the same as the monthly pattern "The first day of every month".

Finally, for yearly patterns, the interval field is treated as a month number (1 for January, 12 for December). The day of week field and day of month field are used as for monthly patterns. The pattern recurs each year on the specified day of the specified month. @author DM

class.name: Money

constructor.name: Money
Money
constructor.doc:
Construct Money from a floating point currency amount. If round is set to true, the amount is rounded to the nearest cent/penny, up on 0.5 or greater, down otherwise. If round is false, the value is truncated to the next lowest number of cents/pence. You can use the supplied constants for rounding/truncation, e.g. 

 Money m = new Money(1.246, Money.kTruncate);
@param amount The money value to be stored. This value should not be larger than (Double.MAX/100). @param round Specifies whether rounding (true) or truncation (false) should occur. @throws RuntimeException A Money was constructed with a double that is Not A Number or Infinite.

class.doc:
Money represents a currency value to two decimal places. Money is constructed with a double-precision floating point value which is rounded or truncated to the nearest cent/penny depending on a flag passed to the constructor. Money is intended to be used to round and store floating point values in a way that they can be reliably tested for equality. It is NOT intended to be used in computations... for this you should use the appropriate floating point datum. Use Money in a series of calculations at the point where it is appropriate (in your design) to perform rounding.

The range and accuracy of the Money data type are the same as for the Java double data type, where the double stores the number of cents/pence. @author Peter Swords

NotFoundIndicator is a class that wraps a boolean value which indicates the status of the singleton read operation. class.name: UniqueID

method.name: nextUniqueID
nextUniqueID

class.doc:
UniqueID creates unique 64-bit values for use as application keys. The values returned are unique within a named "key set". An arbitrary number of differently named key sets is supported. The single public method of this class (nextUniqueID) returns the next 64-bit value in sequence from a set.

Unique IDs address the common application requirement for sequences of distinct values for use as keys devoid of "business meaning". One common technical difficulty is that a number of application processes or threads, which are otherwise non-cooperating, must be able to concurrently generate key values without overlap. A general solution is to provide synchronization via a common resource so that a unique id value can be locked, accessed and updated. One easy approach is to use a row of a database table as the common resource, and to use the lock management facilities of a database engine to synchronize access. This unfortunately can result in a serious database hot-spot that can limit throughput of an entire application. If there is a requirement to generate keys in a contiguous sequence, i.e. without any possibility of "holes" in the sequence, then this database hot-spot may well be unavoidable. However, in the absence of such a requirement, the hi-key/lo-key approach to key generation can mitigate any potential performance issues.

The hi-key/lo-key approach makes use of a key server to generate hi-keys . A hi-key represents the most significant portion (in the binary number sense) of a key value, with the low-key part supplied by the client. The client can thus use all of the lo-key values in a hi-key block without accessing the key server again. When the keys in the block are exhausted, the client gets the next hi-key from the server. Synchronization among clients is limited to those times when it is necessary to access the key server. The key server accesses a database table in order to retrieve the next available hi-key. However, this access is not part of any ongoing client transaction, so the key control value on the database is locked only for long enough to retrieve and update a hi-key value. (An obvious implication is that key values can be "lost" if client transactions are rolled back, or if for any reason a client does not use the values from a ho-key block). Another implication is that increasing key values cannot be assumed to correspond to any chronological ordering, since multiple clients can use key values at any time once they have allocated a hi-key via the key server).

Curam uses 8-bit lo-key values, so there are 256 keys in a block.Hi-keys are 56 bits long, so there is to all intents and purposes an inexhaustible supply of hi-key values in each named key set. Each key set is designated as either "human readable" or "non-human-readable". Both types of key sets result in very large ranges of non-overlapping key values. However, non-human-readable keys are designed to provide keys that are distributed relatively evenly across the 64-bit key value range, which can be useful for some applications. Human-readable key values, on the other hand, start at 1, and are incremented by 1 each time a key is generated (although the caveats about contiguity and ordering noted above still apply). @author Peter Swords

class.doc: The BizObjAssociation entity stores details of associations between tasks and other rows on other database table. This API provides functions to manipulate the data on the BizObjAssociation entity and its functions should be used rather than direct access to the functions present on the actual entity. @author PJ

class.name: BusinessObjectAssociationSearch

method.name: countOpenTasksByBizObjectTypeAndID

class.doc:
A business object association represents an association between a task and a row on a database table. This allows a task to be related to any other row of database data, for example, a person or a case. This facility enables Task functionality to be extended and permits custom application functionality to tie any required information to a task.

This class provides a wrapper around some generic searches and count functions for the BizObjAssociation table. @author FG

class.name: DeadlineScanner

method.name: scanDeadlines
deliverReminders

class.doc:
This class scans for workflow deadlines and invokes the associated handler function to process them.

A workflow deadline pertains to Manual, Event Wait , Decision, Parallel Manual and Parallel Decision activities and it is composed of a deadline duration and an associated handler function. For manual and decision activities, the deadline time is calculated by adding the duration specified in the deadline metadata to the time that the associated task for these activities was created. For event wait activities, the deadline duration is added to the time that the activity was executed and this then becomes the deadline time. Once the activity is executed, it must be completed before the specified deadline time. Otherwise the scanDeadlines() function in this class may be called to determine which deadlines have timed out. The associated handler function specified for the deadline is then invoked for each deadline that has expired.

@author FG

class.name: EnactmentService

method.name: startProcess
startProcess
startProcessInV3CompatibilityMode
method.doc:
Starts a workflow process in v3 compatibility mode. This is a synchronous execution mode required for back-compatibility with v3 Tasks and Notifications. See the warning below.

This method is for use by the Curam application Task and Notification APIs only. Its use outside those APIs (either internally within Curam or externally on customer sites) is not supported. V3 compatibility mode is subject to change without notice in future versions of Curam. Use of this method falls outside the upgrade protection of the Curam Codeline policy.

@param processName The name of the workflow process to be enacted. This is the name given to the process when it was defined in the Process Definition Tool (PDT). @param enactmentStructs list of Curam struct containing the process enactment data. @return The ID of the newly created process instance. @throws AppException {@link WORKFLOW#RUN_ID_STARTING_PROCESS_REQUIRED_WDO_ATTRIBUTES_NOT_SET RUN_ID_STARTING_PROCESS_REQUIRED_WDO_ATTRIBUTES_NOT_SET} if the Curam structs supplied are not sufficient to start the associated process. @throws InformationalException Generic Exception Signature. @see #startProcess(String, List)

class.doc:
Provides facilities for application code to enact workflows. If enactment mappings are specified for the process to be enacted, then a list of Curam structs is passed that provide the data to satisfy the required enactment data specified by the process definition enactment mappings.

The {@link #startProcess(String, List) startProcess} method maps the data passed in to the relevant workflow data objects and then sends a message to start the process asynchronously. If the structs supplied are insufficient to fully populate the enactment data of the required process the process is not started. @author FG

method.name: getWDOSnapshot

class.doc:
This class provides routines that resolve and return the various localizable strings that exist in a workflow process definition for the locale of the current user. This is required since workflow process definitions contain metadata text that needs to be viewed in different languages by different users.

A localizable string in a process definition may contain parameters. The values for these parameters are retrieved from the associated workflow data object snapshots and are included as part of the localizable strings returned from the various routines. @author FG

The workflow engine will retrieve the required NotificationDelivery implementation class via the application property {@link curam.util.resources.EnvironmentConstants.Custom#kNotificationDeliveryClassPropertyName curam.custom.notifications.notificationdelivery} and call the associated deliverNotification function to deliver the specified notification based on the evaluated allocation targets. @author FG

class.doc: The Task entity stores details of a set of instructions to enable a user to perform the manual work required by an activity in a workflow. This API provides functions to manipulate the data on the Task and its functions should be used rather than direct access to the functions present on the actual entity. @author PJ

class.name: TaskAllocationAdmin

method.name: reallocateTask

class.doc:
This class allows application code to request that the specified task be reallocated. This will call the allocation strategy defined and the process definition will then call the application functionality to assign the work to agents that can perform it.

The process of reallocating a task could be quite time consuming so use cases that must return quickly should consider wrapping calls to this API within a deferred process. @author TM

interface.name: TaskAssignmentChecker

method.name: checkTaskAssignment

interface.doc:
The TaskAssignmentChecker callback interface is implemented in the application to define what should happen when a task has not been allocated to any user or work queue after the work resolver has been called for that task.

The workflow engine will retrieve the out-of-the-box TaskAssignmentChecker implementation class via reflection and call the associated checkTaskAssignment function to check if the task has been allocated to any user on the system. If it has not, the task will be assigned to the default work queue for workflow. @author FG

class.name: WorkflowAuditAdmin

method.name: getWDOValuesHistory
searchWDOValuesHistoryByActivityInstance
searchWDOValuesHistoryByProcessInstance
searchWDOValuesHistoryByProcessInstanceAndDate

class.doc:
WorkflowAuditAdmin is an API for examining the workflow data object attribute values associated with the audit information for a workflow process instance.

The value of workflow data object attributes are logged as they are used throughout the process instance lifecycle. The routines in this API query the values of workflow data object attributes at required execution periods in the process instance.

Workflow data object attribute values are logged when they are used:

  • before the execution of an activity
  • after the execution of an activity
  • during transition resolution @author AM

interface.name: WorkResolver

method.name: resolveWork
resolveWork
resolveWork
undoWorkResolution

interface.doc:
The WorkResolver interface contains methods to allocate a task.

An implementation of this class should allocate the task to an agent or agents that can work on it. The methods in this class can be invoked any number of times for the same task (since task reallocation is possible). This being the case, implementations should remove any associations with other entities that were previously created as part of the reallocation. @author TM

field.doc:
The concept of an event class is used to group related event types. For example, an event class of 'Case' describes a set of events related to the status of a 'Case'. The corresponding event types for this event class could be CloseCase, OpenCase, SuspendCase etc.

EVENT_CLASS -> String

The type of the event. (e.g. CASE_CLOSED).

EVENT_TYPE -> String

field.name: eventMatchData
field.doc:
The workflow data object attribute representing the unique identifier related to the event class from which the event is raised. The identifier is passed to the event handler which uses it to find additional information relevant to handling the event. For example, where the business object type specified for an event is equal to 'Case', the event data could be case identifier, i.e. primaryEventData='12345'.

WDO_ATTRIBUTE_ID -> String

field.name: eventOutputData
field.doc:
The event output mapping data is optional. It is intended for events that must represent an association between two entities. An example of this would be an event class of RELATIONSHIP with an associated event type of CHANGED. In this case the primary and secondary event data would represent the relationship that has changed between the two entities.

EVENT_DATA -> long

field.name: raisedByUser

class.name: BusinessObjectAssociationWorkspace

method.name: countBusinessObjectAssociationTasksDueInTheNextWeek
method.doc: Returns a list of counts for reserved and unreserved tasks for a specified business object association grouped by the date that these tasks are due on. This method will be called to return data for a specified number of days of a week. Tasks with a status of CLOSED will not be included in the results. @param key The key required to identify the reserved and unreserved tasks for a specified business object association. The key also includes a task deadline date to search on and also the number of days that results are required for. @return A list of counts for reserved and unreserved tasks for a specified business object association grouped by the date that these tasks are due on. A record is also returned even if there are no tasks reserved or unreserved for that specified data. In this scenario, both the reserved and unreserved counts will be zero. @throws AppException Exceptions that may be thrown when searching for a list of reserved and unreserved tasks for a specified business object association. @throws InformationalException Generic Exception Signature.

method.name: countBusinessObjectAssociationTasksDueInTheNextMonth
method.doc: Returns a list of counts for reserved and unreserved tasks for a specified business object association grouped by the date that these tasks are due on. This method will be called to return data for a specified number of weeks in a month. Tasks with a status of CLOSED will not be included in the results. @param key The key required to identify the reserved and unreserved tasks for a specified business object association. The key also includes a task deadline date to search on and also the number of weeks that results are required for. @return A list of counts for reserved and unreserved tasks for a specified business object association grouped by the date that these tasks are due on. A record is also returned even if there are no tasks reserved or unreserved for that specified data. In this scenario, both the reserved and unreserved counts will be zero. @throws AppException Exceptions that may be thrown when searching for a list of reserved and unreserved tasks for a specified business object association. @throws InformationalException Generic Exception Signature.

method.name: getBusinessObjectAssociationTasksDueOnDate
method.doc: Returns a list of the task details that are associated with a specified business object association that are due on a specific date. This function may be used to search for all tasks due on the specific date, the reserved tasks for a business object association due on that specific date or the unreserved tasks for a business object association due on that specific date. Tasks with a status of CLOSED will not be included in the results. @param key The details required to uniquely identify the business object association whose task details will be returned. The reservation status of the tasks required may also be specified in the search criteria. @return A list of the task details that are associated with a specified business object association that are due on a specific date based on the reservation status of those tasks. @throws AppException Exceptions that may be thrown when searching for the task details that are associated with a specified business object association and are due on a specific date. @throws InformationalException Generic Information Exception.

method.name: getBusinessObjectAssociationTasksDueByWeek
method.doc: Returns a list of the task details that are associated with a specified business object association that are due within the next week. This function may be used to search for all tasks due within that week, the reserved tasks for a business object association due within that week or the unreserved tasks for a business object association due within the specified week. Tasks with a status of CLOSED will not be included in the results. @param key The details required to uniquely identify the business object association whose task details will be returned. The reservation status of the tasks required may also be specified in the search criteria. @return A list of the task details that are associated with a specified business object association that are due within the next week based on the reservation status of those tasks. @throws AppException Exceptions that may be thrown when searching for the task details that are associated with a specified business object association and are due within the next week. @throws InformationalException Generic Information Exception.

method.name: getBusinessObjectAssociationTasks
method.doc: Returns a list of the task details for a specified business object association. Depending on the input parameter data, the function may return all of the tasks associated with a specified business object association, all of the reserved tasks associated with a specified business object association or all the tasks that have not yet been reserved for a specified business object association. Tasks with a status of CLOSED will not be included in the results. @param key The input parameter data required to uniquely identify the business object association whose list of tasks details will be returned. @return A list of the task details for a specified business object association. @throws AppException Exceptions that may be thrown when searching for the tasks associated with a specified business object association. @throws InformationalException Generic Information Signature.

method.name: countBusinessObjectAssociationReservedTasksByUser
getBusinessObjectAssociationTasksByUser
method.doc: Returns a list of the task details for a specified business object association based on the user that has reserved the task and the status of the task. Tasks with a status of CLOSED will not be included in the results. @param key The fields required to search for all of the tasks associated with a specified business object association based on whether the task is reserved or not and the status of the tasks. @return A list of the task details for a specified business object association based on user that has reserved the task and the status of the task. @throws AppException Exceptions that may be thrown when searching for the list of tasks associated with a business object association based on the user that has reserved the task and the status of the task. @throws InformationalException Generic Exception Signature.

class.doc: The BusinessObjectAssociationWorkspace class provides the API methods to allow supervisors to search for tasks that are associated with a specified business object. @author FG

field.doc:
The deadline date to be used in the search. The search will use this date as the current week to begin the search for the case tasks.

DEADLINE_DATE -> curam.util.type.Date

field.name: numberOfWeeks
field.doc:
The number of weeks to search for tasks associated with the specified case and are due. The number of weeks is added to the deadline time specified and all of the tasks associated with the case and are due within that time period are returned from the search.

NUMBER_OF_DAYS -> int
